Crimes.Dispute_Type: Civil litigation involving allegations of false testimony
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Whether a law firm should be disqualified due to potential witness involvement
Crimes.Evidence_Assessment: No definitive evidence that Lang Michener lawyers would testify
Crimes.Decision_Outcome: Application to remove law firm dismissed
Crimes.Burden_of_Proof: On plaintiff to show clear conflict or impropriety
Crimes.Credibility_Factor: Alleged influence on Dr. Billmeyer's testimony
Crimes.Legal_Rule: Rule 1733 (setting aside judgment for fraud); Rule 327 (trial of issues arising from motions)
Crimes.Standard_of_Review: Necessity and fairness in disqualification decisions
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Prematurity of motion to disqualify counsel
Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: Alleged fraud through influencing expert witness
Crimes.Outcome_on_Merits: No finding of misconduct; case proceeded
Crimes.Review_Standard: Clear evidence of conflict or impropriety required
Crimes.Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: Court emphasized avoiding unnecessary disqualification to maintain fair process
Crimes.Key_Evidence_Considered: Nature of communications between defendants' counsel and expert witness
Crimes.Applicant_Challenge: Plaintiff sought removal of Lang Michener as counsel
Crimes.Standard_of_Proof: Clear and convincing evidence standard implied
Crimes.Defendant_Response: Denial of improper influence on expert
Crimes.Outcome: Motion dismissed, trial continued with current representation
Crimes.Remedy_Sought: Removal of Lang Michener from representation
Crimes.Resolution_Mechanism: Hearing on motion with legal argument and submissions
Crimes.Grounds_for_Inadmissibility_or_Allegatio: Potential conflict of interest and fraud
Crimes.Pending_Relief_or_Application: None pending after dismissal of motion
Crimes.Governing_Rule: Rule 1733 and general principles of professional conduct

Crimes.Dispute_Type: Civil litigation involving alleged manipulation of expert testimony
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Possibility of disqualifying counsel who may become witnesses
Crimes.Evidence_Assessment: Insufficient evidence that Lang Michener attorneys would testify
Crimes.Burden_of_Proof: On moving party to establish reasonable possibility of testimony or conflict
Crimes.Credibility_Factor: Allegations against Dr. Billmeyer’s impartiality due to defense counsel influence
Crimes.Legal_Rule: Rule 1733 allows setting aside judgments based on fraud
Crimes.Standard_of_Review: Judicial discretion guided by necessity and fairness
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Timeliness and basis for disqualification motion
Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: Alleged fraudulent behavior by expert influenced by defense counsel
Crimes.Outcome_on_Merits: No finding of fraud; claim not substantiated at this stage
Crimes.Review_Standard: Requirement of clear evidence of conflict or impropriety
Crimes.Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: Court prioritized continuity of representation absent clear conflict
Crimes.Key_Evidence_Considered: Nature and extent of interaction between defense counsel and expert witness
Crimes.Legal_Framework: Rules governing ethical conduct and disqualification of counsel
Crimes.Applicant_Challenge: Plaintiff challenged legitimacy of defense counsel participation
Crimes.Court_Result: Defendants’ counsel allowed to continue representation
Crimes.Standard_of_Proof: Clear and convincing evidence expected but not met
Crimes.Defendant_Response: Denied any unethical conduct or improper influence
Crimes.Outcome: Application dismissed; trial to proceed as scheduled
Crimes.Resolution_Mechanism: Adjudication of motion with hearings and written submissions
Crimes.Grounds_for_Inadmissibility_or_Allegatio: Potential witness bias and attorney conflict of interest
Crimes.Outcome_of_Review: No disqualification; matter remains subject to future review
